p: For cobalt-modified δ-MnO 2 cathode, both catalysis routes contribute to the deposition process. Of importance, the well-dispersed cobalt-containing species could serve as preferred active sites by providing enhanced charge-transfer capability, thereby demonstrating a much superior deposition rate. On the contrary, the deposition of active Mn compound was still observed but less significant ( Figure 4A) for the cathode without cobalt modification, as the catalysis could only rely on the Mn self-catalysis route.
